title: Library Options Schema
description: Creates a new generic library project in the current workspace.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the library?

scope.description: The npm scope of the library.

ci.description: Determine which CI tool to use.
ci.x-prompt: Which CI would you like to use?

repositoryUrl.x-prompt: What is you repository's host url? (https://github.com/...)

skipLib.description: When true, will not create the library

entryFile.description: The path at which to create the library's public API file, relative to the workspace root.

prefix.description: A prefix to apply to generated selectors.

skipPackageJson.description: When true, does not add dependencies to the "package.json" file.

skipInstall.description: When true, does not install dependency packages.

skipTsConfig.description: When true, does not update "tsconfig.json" to add a path mapping for the new library. The path mapping is needed to use the library in an app, but can be disabled here to simplify development.

skipSchematics.description: When true, does not set schematics to support "ng add ..." command

skipAngularCliGhPages.description: When true, skips setting angular-cli-ghpages configurations

botName.description: This name will be used while deploying on GitHub Pages
botName.x-prompt: What name should we use for deploying on GitHub Pages? (e.g. Mr. X's Bot)

botEmail.description: This email will be used while deploying on GitHub Pages
botEmail.x-prompt: What email should we use for deploying on GitHub Pages?

cocEmail.description: This email will be used in Code of Conduct
cocEmail.x-prompt: What email should we use for Code of Conduct?

importModule.description: When true, "ng add ..." command will import your module in client. Works only if skipPrompts is true

importStatement.description: The import statement when run through ng add. Works only if importModule is true

packages.description: 3rd party packages to add when run through ng add. Works only if skipPrompts is true
